intro: Chirocalyx velutinus, commonly known as the velvet calyx plant, is a unique species characterized by its soft, velvety texture on its calyx. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is native to tropical regions of South America. The plant features lanceolate leaves with a pubescent surface, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Its flowers are typically pink or purple, with a showy structure that attracts pollinators. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
